title: Religious, churchy type serif face, similar to Mason
content:
Hi,  
Trying to match this font which was originally supplied as tiff for a client.

Indentifont and find-a-font suggest Mason which is close.

Maybe this has been modified as the lower case “u” and “n” doesn’t seem to match the other uppercase letters?

Any thoughts or help appreciated

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114011900im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ABUNANTIA_5679.png)

 [‹ (x) type in Mitsubishi logo - custom design {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114011900/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38124 "Go to previous forum topic") [Gerald R. Ford & Venrock Associates letterheads, similar to Engravers/Sackers Roman ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071114011900/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38107 "Go to next forum topic")
author: aspace

comments.content:
Mason was a very popular font at the time it was released, and many copycats were produced shortly thereafter. This could be one of those.

- Lex
